RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPOOKY ONE tracked the early leader from the outside two deep, raced four to five wide in the drive and finished well to surge up late under strong pressure. BRIT'S CANDYMAN was sent to a clear early lead, remained clear inside the eighth but gave way to the winner grudgingly late. FEDERAL CASE chased the pace from the inside and kept on willingly to the wire. BEYOND THE BEND lag early on to trail, raced near the inside around the far turn, was three to four wide in the drive and closed in mildly. U U STAR dropped back off the early pace, raced four to five wide into the upper stretch and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Brit's Candyman
ENTRY.OWNER: Stevark Stable Inc and Rentz Randy

ENTRY.NAME: U U Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4-5w upper stretch, lacked bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MEET ME AT MUNDIS was off slowly, settled along the inside after the poor start, circled five wide through the far turn into the stretch and edged up to prove best under steady handling. DOWNTOWNCHALYBROWN stalked the pace, raced made a four to three wide bid in the drive and finished gamely to the wire. MOBEER set a pressured early pace from the outside of rival two deep, had a clear lead near the eighth pole and weakened in the final stages. JEAN VALJEAN vied for the early lead along the inside and weakened in the drive. DON'T LOSEMYMONEY settled off the early pace, raced near the inside and had no response. PICTOR dropped back early, was three wide around the far turn and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Meet Me At Mundis
ENTRY.OWNER: Siedler Craig and Simoff Andrew L
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, settled inside, circled 5-wide, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Losemymoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside, no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR RONNY ALAN tracked the early leader two deep, took aim near the eighth pole three deep and edged up under strong encouragement. SUMMER ASH was off slowly, void of early speed, raced from the far outside in the stretch and closed in belatedly to narrowly secure the place position. KAZ MUNNINGS stalked the pace, hard ridden three through the far turn and kept on willingly to the wire. MONEYONTHELINE raced mid pack early, was four to five wide around the far turn and raced evenly no final bid. LARZ sprinted clear early on and faltered the final eighth of a mile. MILLBANK MAN raced with the second flight, was four deep near the three sixteenths pole and needed more in the drive. DORSODURO chased the pace from the inside and faded. LONG TOM unhurried early, swung six wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. COUSIN BOB saved ground and never threatened. MR BOLDACIOUS void of early speed and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Boldacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: void of speed, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Cousin Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, saved ground, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Ash
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, no speed, belatedly, outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 77. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lb s.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUSTIN DOWN DOORS showed good early speed and held gamely to be clear under steady handling. KAZ MUSIC chased the early leaders three wide and moved up to finish second best. NAIL POLISH coaxed along early from the inside, angled through the upper stretch to race well off the inside and kept on to the wire. UGHROUDA raced far back and never threatened. SWEET BEAUTY forwardly place to lay up closed early, was injured and had to be vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Down Doors
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, held gamely, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since Novemb er 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHISTLER'S STYLE broke to the outside, tracked the from the outside of rivals, made an early three wide bid, raced from the inside around the far turn and held safe late under a steady hand ride. LINDALOVESGOLD stalked the pace, raced two wide past the quarter pole, was four deep in the drive and closed in slowly on the winner. RAW POWER rated back under a firm hold to race near the back, ridden through the far turn, raced four wide into the upper stretch and was even late with no closing run on the top pair. CHARM ALARM was unhurried early on, moved up four wide through the far turn and lacked a closing bid. WINGS OF A SONG stalked the pace from the inside and faded. WILL OR WON'T showed good early foot early and tired readily the final quarter of a mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Charm Alarm
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, 4wd far turn, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Raw Power
ENTRY.OWNER: Ioia Joseph Ioia Gayle and Spina Chuck

ENTRY.NAME: Whistler's Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outside, tracked outside, held safe, hand ride

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARGO SHIP rated three deep early on, raced four to five wide in the stretch run and edged up from the outside of rivals under steady pressure. SUTTON BREEZE showed good early foot to set the early pace along the inside and gave way late to the winner grudgingly. BOURBON CURRENCY was bumped, squeezed back at the start, had an inside run and needed more in the drive. SHANGHAI SUPERFLY raced off the early pace, swung six wide into the upper stretch, shifted in through the stretch run and had no final bid. ANNAMATED MOON chased the pace from the inside and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Currency
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, squeezed break, inside run, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Sutton Breeze
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Shanghai Superfly
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 6wd upper stretch, shift in, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DR RAGS rated along near the inside, continued a rail bid in the stretch run and edged clear under stead pressure. HE IS BAD chased the early leader two deep, raced four wide nearing the eighth pole and kept on gamely to the wire. BOSS HOLIDAY sprinted clear from the outside, dug in nearing the eighth pole and gave way late grudgingly. SPELLED WELL void of early speed, raced near the inside past the five sixteenths pole, eased out through the upper lane and closed in mildly. WICKED IRISHMAN settled off the early pace, raced along the inside around the far turn into the upper stretch and had not enough in the drive. HOLY CITY dropped back early, raced three to four wide in the drive and had no late rally. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN raced mid pack early, swung six wide into the lane and lacked a solid bid. NOTORIOUS REY chased the early pace two deep and gave way.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dark Hollow Farm, D. Brown, Davidov & Schwaber

ENTRY.NAME: Spelled Well
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, inside 5/16, eased out, mildly
